content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

The operation of all shops and stores is allowed, but hygienic rules have to be strictly followed. Bear in mind that COVID-19 did not disappear with the lift of bans on free movement and on shops and services. Be considerate to other people inside shops, follow strictly hygienic rules, try to avoid close distance contact – keep at least 2 meters distance from other people, and wear face masks all the time.

Opening hours

Opening hours are no longer limited by special crisis measures.

Hygiene rules

When going shopping follow strict hygienic rules. Wearing a face mask and keeping a 2-meter distance from other customers is mandatory, especially when waiting in a queue. Every time you enter a shop disinfection gel or spray need to be available at the entrance – use it. On arrival back home wash your hands. 

Shopping with disposable gloves increases the protection against the virus. Do not touch surfaces unnecessarily. Bakery products, fruits, and vegetables touch ONLY with the gloves on or use a disposable plastic bag.

A group of a maximum of 10 persons is allowed to enter a shop. The exemption is people living in the same household. The maximum number of persons allowed in a shop is limited by the sales to 1 person per 15m^2. 

In stores with an area of less than 15m^2, this restriction will not affect adolescents younger than 15 years of age, handicapped people owning a ZTP card. In stores, larger than 15m^2 exemption to the total number of people inside will be kids younger than 6 years of age accompanying another customer. Handicapped people owning a ZTP card will have the privilege to enter the shop first in line, so they will not have to wait in queues. Owners and operators of shops and stores must not require a person with a stroller to enter only with a shopping cart. A child in a stroller is not counted within the maximum limit of 15m^2 per shopping area.

It is also mandatory to adopt regime and organizational measures and queue management (in front of and in the shop).

Even though the epidemic situation is slightly better, try to buy products on e-shops. When coming personally to a shop it is recommended to pay by a credit or debit card.

If you are part of a higher risk group or are in quarantine (isolation), ask a neighbor, relative, or friend to do your shopping. If this isn't possible, you can reach out to volunteers. Help and deliveries to high-risk groups and the infected), who will be happy to help. You can also order online and get your shopping delivered to your doorstep.

questions_answers.question: How many people at once can go shopping?
questions_answers.value: A maximum limit of 10 persons in one group. Exemptions are people living in the same household.

questions_answers.question: When are the shops and stores opened?
questions_answers.value: Opening hours are not limited anymore. It is up to individual owners of shops to regulate their opening hours.

questions_answers.question: Can shops and stores be opened on Sundays and holidays?
questions_answers.value: Yes, it is not forbidden anymore. It is up to individual owners of shops to regulate their opening hours.

questions_answers.question: Can i pay cash?
questions_answers.value: Yes. Paying by debit or credit card is recommended though.

questions_answers.question: Are the shopping malls opened?
questions_answers.value: Yes, but there are extra hygienic measures you have to strictly follow.

questions_answers.question: Can i go shopping when im in quarantine or in isolation?
questions_answers.value: It is HIGHLY advised to order food online or ask for help from the neighbors. In exceptional cases visit a small shop off rush hour. Be as quick as possible, wear a respirator WITHOUT breath-out ventile, and disposable gloves.

questions_answers.question: Can I try out clothes and shoes?
questions_answers.value: Yes. Before the try out it is necessary to disinfect your hands. All tried out goods has to be quarantined by the shop owner for 24 hours, before putting it back on the store.

questions_answers.question: Může mít můj obchod nadále jen výdejní okénko?
questions_answers.value: Ano, znovu otevření provozovny není povinné. Stále není nutné využívat profesionální zásilkovny, každý obchod může mít takto zařízenou svou vlastní výdejnu. Zboží je také možné dovézt zákazníkům domů.

questions_answers.question: Does e-sales evidence work?
questions_answers.value: No. Evidence is paused until the end of 2022.

questions_answers.question: Are the banks opened?
questions_answers.value: Yes. Opening hours of different banks and their branches may vary. Keep yourself informed on the exact opening hours on your bank's website.
